â€œFunding alone doesn't build startups. Nurturing does.â€ â€” Prof. Ashok Jhunjhunwala

Team Startup India; Mamatha Venkatesh, Ritwik Malhotra, and Snehansh Sinha, engaged in an insightful discussion with Prof. Ashok Jhunjhunwala at IIT Madras Research Park.

A visionary in India's innovation and deeptech landscape, Prof. Jhunjhunwala has been instrumental in shaping the incubation ecosystem. The meeting revolved around strengthening two foundational pillars of the startup ecosystem: access to funding and the growth and nurturing incubation centers across the country. 

From exploring sustainable incubation models to fostering stronger industry-academia linkages, the conversation brought forward actionable ideas to empower early-stage startups and scale impactful innovations.

Startup India remains committed to collaborating with ecosystem leaders like Prof. Jhunjhunwala to build a robust, inclusive, and self-reliant startup landscape and contribute to a #ViksitBharat

In a collaborative effort to further strengthen Bharat's startup ecosystem, the Startup India team met with StartupTN for a focused discussion on innovation, funding, and incubation support.

The meeting addressed key queries raised by incubators and early-stage angel investors, emphasizing the need for streamlined support systems, greater funding accessibility, and enhanced coordination at the state level. The Startup India team also reaffirmed its commitment to the ecosystem by extending support for the upcoming Global Tamil Nadu Startup Summit â€” a flagship platform to spotlight the state's entrepreneurial talent on a global scale.

This engagement marks a significant step towards fostering a more robust, collaborative, and opportunity-rich startup environment in Tamil Nadu and beyond.

â­ New development in a novel broad-spectrum antibiotic from India!

Bugworks Research Inc., a CCAMP supported and incubated startup, has partnered with Global Antibiotic R&D Partnership (GARDP) to co-develop the oral formulation of their novel broad spectrum anti-bacterial candidate - BWC0977!

Already in clinical trials with their intravenous (IV) formulation of BWC0977, this collaboration with GARDP will advance this oral formulation for comprehensive clinical trials alongside ongoing pharmaceutical development and commercialisation of their antibiotic

The oral formulation, a step-down from the IV formulation of BWC0977, will be a game-changer for treatment of critical infections in low-resource settings. BWC0977 has already demonstrated potent activity against all WHO critical priority pathogens
